sentence.Network_en: Rules governing student conduct relaxed somewhat in recent years.

sentence.Network_en: Dart, who had at first been very tense, at last relaxed.

sentence.Network_en: The West has gradually relaxed its hostile attitude to this influential state.

entry.tran: 放松的;松弛的;安心的;轻松的
entry.def: If you are relaxed, you are calm and not worried or tense.

example.ex: As soon as I had made the final decision, I felt a lot more relaxed...
example.tran: 我一作出最后的决定就感到轻松多了。

example.ex: Try to adopt a more relaxed manner.
example.tran: 试着换一种更加放松的方式。

entry.tran: (地方或情形)轻松的，舒适的，使人安心的
entry.def: If a place or situation is relaxed, it is calm and peaceful.

example.ex: The atmosphere at lunch was relaxed.

sentences.sentence: "gave the impression of being quite relaxed"

Sentence.sentence: Some people say relief…because they find themselves so relaxed.

means.word_mean: (人)轻松的;自在的,随便的;无拘无束的

sentences.en: He sat in a relaxed pose.
A relaxed atmosphere prevails in the club.
sentences.cn: 俱乐部里充满轻松的气氛。

sentences.en: Among her friends, casual dress and a relaxed manner are the rule.
sentences.cn: 她的朋友一般都衣着休闲，举止也轻松随意。

sentences.en: I had a sauna this morning,so now I feel really relaxed.
sentences.cn: 我今天早晨去洗了个桑拿浴,现在觉得很舒坦。
